title: Make every new champions/reworks disabled in ranked and unbanable in Normal Draft for a week.
body:
I'm tired of losing games because someone picked a new champion / reworked champion and didn't know how to play him, ending feeding as hell.
I'm tired of not being able to learn to play as, with or against a new champion / reworked champion because some idiot bans it in normal game.
Make this stop please.

Also, "I own a PBE account so I learned how to play it" isn't an acceptable excuse.

You're objectively wrong on all accounts. And fortunately I'm bored at work, so I'll go ahead and take you to school; despite it not being appreciated, because I dared defy the holy boards sacrament of "yasuo is the most disastrously toxic thing since Chernobyl." Plus it's the internet, so no one cares.

Firstly, I don't main (or even play) Yasuo. I'm a jungler main who dabbles in top. I've probably played less than 10 Yasuo games since 2014, and I don't think an average of 3 games a year makes a main. 

Secondly, please refer to this thread: 
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4129742&page=1

While I won't go and dig up 100+ threads from 5 years ago, this one is pretty large and does a pretty good job of showing general opinions on Yasuo at the time. Everyone was trying to figure him out, a moderate amount of people thought he had potential but weren't sure how, and the slight majority weren't convinced he'd amount to much without buffs (which he received). 

Other than the OP, who was making an argument for Yasuo being hilariously overpowered once it was discovered how well he worked. It's worth noting that, despite the OP forewarning about Yasuo being a huge balance headache.. He praises Riot for making a champion who's skillful and really does take finesse to play.

Because, despite how much the boards may whine and scream the opposite, Yasuo does actually take skill to play. He is (especially after numerous and repeated nerfings) more mechanically intensive than a fair number of mages, most bruisers / fights / divers, and all ADC's aside from perhaps Draven. He's very twitchy and positioning sensitive, but also offers numerous avenues to bully the crap out of him and take advantage / kill him, as well as a decently long cooldown on his ability to prevent that.

TL-DR: Read, it's not long and you're not doing anything important with your life right now.

To solidify my point, I refer you to the second mentioned thread:
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4792996

Tangentially related, but still related. Gnar was another champion with a very similar reception to Yasuo. A majority thought he was garbage (gnarbage), others weren't sure as he hadn't been around long, and a small minority recognized him for the threat he really was.

Similar to Yasuo, Gnar also received nothing but buffs and bug fixes the first patch after his release. I want you to keep in mind how ASTOUNDINGLY rare that was 3+ years ago. Most releases back in those days were insanely broken. Zyra, Jinx, Zyra, Jinx, Diana, Zac, Rek'sai, Vi, Thresh, and others were released very close in relation to Yasuo (and gnar I guess)... And were all stupendously broken upon release, receiving a majority of nerfs (and, of course, bug fixes) soon after hitting the rift.

Opinion wise, I'd argue that Yasuo is a very well designed champion due to his skill expression. He's far from binary and a lot of how a lane will go depends on the Yasuo player. Not because Yasuo is some omfg-wtf-bbq-ggnore monster, but a lot of league's older design (and intentionally some of the newer) is super binary. So having options makes him difficult, and gives him the ability to outplay, or royally mess up, in most situations. 

Same as Gnar, incidentally.

I believe I have a better idea:

'Players are banned from using Champions in Ranked Matches unless they have used them X amount of times.'

This would stop Players from using a Champion first time in Ranked regardless of whether the Champion was recently released or here since the dawn of time.
It should be mandatory that a Player knows the basics (at minimum) before they participate in a game-mode designed for serious play.

-- 'But what about players who recently became Level 30?' --

 A new player has to go through 200 - 300 matches (I'm not counting Smurfs) before they become Level 30. This gives them enough time to learn the basics of several Champions, especially when taking into account the Free Champion Rotation and the incentive to play Champions you earn through purchases or rewards.

-- 'But what about OTPs? --

An OTP should still learn the basics of several other Champions/Roles. This is so they:

*  Don't screw over their Team-mates by picking an ill-fitting Champion for the Team-comp (Damage Type Heavy, Lacking a crucial Role, etc)
* Don't lock in a Champion that's strongly countered by the opponent (The enemy locks in Teemo? Better pick Nasus)
* Don't cause chaos in the Champion Selection process when they don't get the desired Role (Hi, I'm a Shaco OTP that got auto-filled into ADC. I'm either getting the Role I want or locking in Shaco and trolling my Team-mates).
It's 63 wins to get to level 30 from level 1, with no xp boosts
